formattedAddress: 25 E 77th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

editorialSummary.text: Elevated dining room offering all-day menus with globally inspired fare and drinks in an elegant setting.

originalText.text: This review is for the CHALET restaurant pop up for the holidays at the Mark.  Its outside in covered chalet style add on.  Felt like you were in Alsace.great fondue the best we ever had,  delicious salad and the service was great.  We wanted cocktails our waiter, I think k his name was Stephen had to shuttle between the hotel bar and the chalet. He did an amazing job. Great winter experience

originalText.text:
Our local friends chose this restaurant for a quick dinner catch up to celebrate a bday. We sat at the nice large  table right at the back of the restaurant Service was friendly and attentive.

We tried the warm shrimp salad and burgers. The salad was decent but the dressing was too acidic to my tastes; the burger was okay nothing special.

Thanks to the lovely gesture and brought out a dessert plate with a candle and chocolate writing of happy birthday on the plate.

text.text:
Our local friends chose this restaurant for a quick dinner catch up to celebrate a bday. We sat at the nice large  table right at the back of the restaurant Service was friendly and attentive.

We tried the warm shrimp salad and burgers. The salad was decent but the dressing was too acidic to my tastes; the burger was okay nothing special.

Thanks to the lovely gesture and brought out a dessert plate with a candle and chocolate writing of happy birthday on the plate.

originalText.text:
This review is for The Mark Chalet by Jean-Georges. It was a terrible dining experience.  Side note - we love (LOVE) the other Jean-Georges restaurants in nyc (ABCv, abc kitchen, abc cucina) and the inn at pound ridge.

Our first course was the onion tart. I’m pretty sure my dog could have prepared something better, and she doesn’t have thumbs. It tasted like it was a frozen tart that had defrosted and re-froze many times over. It also looked like something mass produced you might buy in the frozen section of any third tier supermarket. It cost more than $30. Two thumbs down. The “salad” was a few pieces of limp and flavorless mesclun. Fail.

The fondue was boiling within 20 seconds of being on the flame - it was way too hot - we both have burnt tongues. There was no way to reduce the flame or lift the pot. The vegetables to dip in the fondue were old, limp, and soggy. That broccoli smell you get when broccoli needs to be thrown out. The bread was so stale and some pieces were wet. The cornichons were dried-out limp. It was the opposite of delicious and delightful.

Skipped dessert to get out there as fast as possible. While we waited for the bill, the staff had trouble closing our flame and burned a hole in the table cloth. There definitely was an issue with the set-up.

We wish we could time travel backwards and not spend the first day of 2024 here. 100% inedible. 100% regret. Disappointment all around.

originalText.text: Beautiful restaurant. Impeccable service. So difficult to choose one dish. We started off with the crispy salmon sushi and warm artichoke appetizers, and then I enjoyed The Mark burger. We also shared chickpea fries. What a treat!

text.text: Beautiful restaurant. Impeccable service. So difficult to choose one dish. We started off with the crispy salmon sushi and warm artichoke appetizers, and then I enjoyed The Mark burger. We also shared chickpea fries. What a treat!

originalText.text: Friends and I stopped in for a light bite to eat! We’re seated promptly and the service was great. We shared the crispy salmon, oysters, and caviar. The waiter was able to bring gluten free bread and was knowledgeable on cross contamination and gluten ingredients. Drinks were tasty as well!

The waiter was able to bring gluten free bread and was knowledgeable on cross contamination and gluten ingredients. Drinks were tasty as well!
